thread.title: Weekend TV: 'Undateable,' 'Good Wife'

title: Weekend TV: 'Undateable,' 'Good Wife'
text:
USA TODAY's Robert Bianco previews the television lineup for Friday, October 9. 'The Walking Dead' begins it's 6th season. VPC
Chris D'Elia returns as Danny on 'Undateable.' (Photo: Chris Haston, NBC)
1 CONNECT 44 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE Undateable
NBC, Friday, 8 ET/PT
This NBC sitcom returns with two episodes, and a new gimmick. Every episode this season is scheduled to air live — on both coasts.
The Walking Dead
AMC, Sunday, 9 ET/PT
Odds are true Walking Dead -heads don't have to be told what's walking their way, as they've been counting the days since this incredibly popular series ended its season. But just in case: Dead returns Sunday for another eight-episode run. The first outing runs an extended 90 minutes, and be prepared to watch quickly, as secrets won't hold.
Jason Crouse (Jeffrey Dean Morgan) joins this season of 'The Good Wife.' (Photo: Paul Sarkis, CBS)
The Good Wife
CBS, 9:30 ET/9 PT
Good Wife follows its strong start with an even better second episode, as Alicia tackles a suitably complex case pitting artistic freedom against personal rights. Every shift the show has made in this new season looks promising, starting with the addition of three terrific and well-incorporated actors — Margo Martindale, Cush Jumbo and, this week, Jeffrey Dean Morgan — and a shift in Alicia's outlook that has returned some lightness to the character. Eventually, it might be nice to see Alicia work her way back into Diane's good graces, but for now, Good Wife stands as a testament to the ability of an excellent series to change course without losing its way.
